body.p:
Decem the 4th 1863
Greeneville, Ky.
to his Excelency Thos E Bramlett
and John. F. Boyle
Adjut. gen. of. Ky.

Sir, I have the honor to report to you that Last night myselfe and a few of the 35 ky mounted Infantry and my little, com.d, of State guards attacted the Infamous, Lutenant, Col, Robt, M. Martin guirillar that has Bin infestin Southern Ky, Ever since the Rebellion We over, took, them in greeneville about 9 oclock and drove them from the town it. Being dark we got mixt on the Streets and was unable to distinguish our own men
from the guirilas we capturd Several guns and coats I capturd one of his officials which I Enclose to you that you may know how this Region is Empossd. upon By a Set of murdurous Robers tohoo would disgrace the Most Savage myscreants hells own dominon they have Rob,d. murder,d, and done all the out Rages to civilization that the fiends of hell, could Invent
Sir I am working to organize the State guard acording to your orders well Report to you Soon

Sir I will try to capture those guirilas Before. I they Escape from the county had I forty men I would drive them from the State or capture them
I will soon Be able to Report you a full company In a few days Ready for their arms &= =

Sir in my Report to you on the Reception of my comission as colonel of the 71st. Regt. Ky., jointed Saying to you that I presented M. Leff. Roark per comission to him as lutenant, Col he cant accept of his comission from the fact that he is comissioned to fill an office in the government of the U. S. etc Sir I take greate pleasure in Recomending. T. S. lewis as a Suitable apointment to that office &. .=

Your Respectfully
Sebastian.C. Vicks
Colonel, com.
the 71st Regt
ky. mia.

Ky State Militia
Muhlenberg Co
S C Vick
Col 71st Regt
Date 2nd Dec
Recd I G O
7 Dec 63
Sir I hope that I will Be able to Send you a look of Rebell Boob marting hair By next mail
